Description: Upper body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior: reserved band at top, black below; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of horse rider in oriental dress to right (head of rider wearing a headdress and part of shoulder, brandishing a spear; part of head and neck of horse).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1161)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (49, pl. 27, 24)
